title: ESG - Data Quality - Senior Professional
content:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
KKR & Co. Inc., together with its subsidiaries, is a leading global investment firm that offers alternative asset management and capital markets and insurance solutions. KKR aims to generate attractive investment returns by following a patient and disciplined investment approach, employing world-class people, and supporting growth in its portfolio companies and communities. KKR sponsors investment funds that invest in private equity, credit and real assets and has strategic partners that manage hedge funds. KKR’s insurance subsidiaries offer retirement, life and reinsurance products under the management of The Global Atlantic Financial Group. POSITION DESCRIPTION
KKR is building out an enterprise data group to collect, manage, and harness the power of data across our diverse portfolio investments. Reporting into the Global Markets Operations team, this group will help ensure all KKR data is accessible, consumable, and drive the curation of insights across the organization.
The KKR Data Operations group is seeking an experienced data management professional to join KKR’s ESG Data Operations function. Reporting directly to KKR’s Head of ESG Data Operations, this is an opportunity to fully own the quality of the firm’s ESG data and ensure that KKR is collecting all required ESG data points in a timely and effective fashion.
Strategic, analytical, innovative and displaying a strong attention to detail, this team member will cover all ESG Data Collection requirements and Quality Assurance across KKR’s Portfolio. This data collection includes, but is not limited to, Portfolio Company surveys (across all asset classes), ad-hoc internal data requests, and tracking for KKR’s Human Capital Center of Excellence.  The ideal candidate has very strong experience with SQL, is a fast learner, and is unafraid to learn the nuances of data collection and data governance platforms that KKR currently leverages for data collection and QA.
RESPONSIBILITIES

Implement and own best in class data governance practices; ensuring that data is well defined & transparently documented (what data exists, where does it exist, and how is it being used).
Gather requirements from internal stakeholders to understand ESG Data needs (what data needs to be collected, how often is it collected, who is it coming from).
Facilitate ESG Data Collection efforts across KKR’s Portfolio, including ad-hoc data requests and recurring quarterly and annual data collection efforts.
Develop and own critical business processes that maintain controls to ensure high quality data; seeking to systematically control & measure data quality (creating data quality rules and validations, implementing routine data quality checks, and introducing exception reporting)
Determine root cause for data quality errors, and make recommendations for long term strategic solutions as well as owning the tactical remediation required to get data to required level of quality
Ensure standards are developed for scalable processes throughout the lifecycle of a deal with well-defined information properly captured throughout that cycle
Collaborate with engineering and IT to support and make recommendations for automated data reconciliation.
Ad-hoc data projects supporting colleagues across the Data Operations group.

QUALIFICATIONS

Expert technical skills in data querying & manipulation; must have advanced (expert) Excel and SQL skills – comfort with large sets of poorly structured data. Working knowledge of Python a plus.
Basic analytical & data visualization capabilities (experience in using Tableau, Power BI or similar tools to support basic reporting).
Excellent stakeholder management skills with the ability to hit deadlines consistently.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; detail oriented with strong analytical and quantitative skills, coupled with qualitative insight.
Collaborative and active contributor, with a “roll-up-your-sleeves” attitude in a fast-paced environment
Proven ability to manage demands of multiple projects in a fast-paced work environment, including ability to prioritize time efficiently and handle competing priorities while remaining connected to the details
High level of intellectual curiosity, accountability, and drive; self-motivated with the ability to work autonomously
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Accounting, Finance, Information Systems, or other related fields; and/or relevant industry experience
Experience working with ESG Data in a Public or Private Markets setting
Experience with Power Apps/Power Automate a plus
Experience with Data collection software platforms a plus

 KKR is an equal opportunity employer.  Individuals seeking employment are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by applicable law.
